concise_definition: v. 获得, 买入, 取得

definitions.explanation_en: To gain possession or ownership of something, typically through purchase, effort, or gradual process.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过购买、努力或渐进过程获得某物的所有权或占有权。
definitions.example_en: The company acquired a smaller competitor to expand its market share.
definitions.example_cn: 该公司收购了一家较小的竞争对手以扩大其市场份额。

definitions.explanation_en: To obtain or develop a skill, habit, or quality over time through experience or learning.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过经验或学习逐渐获得某种技能、习惯或品质。
definitions.example_en: She acquired a fluent command of French after living in Paris for five years.
definitions.example_cn: 她在巴黎生活五年后，掌握了流利的法语。

definitions.explanation_en: To come into possession of something, especially something intangible such as a reputation, trait, or condition.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指获得某种无形之物，如声誉、特质或状态。
definitions.example_en: He acquired a reputation for being unreliable after missing several deadlines.
definitions.example_cn: 他因多次错过截止日期而获得了不可靠的名声。

comparison.analysis: “Obtain” (获得) 更侧重于成功取得某物，常用于正式语境，强调结果而非过程，且不强调方式（如购买或学习）。而 “acquire” 更常暗示一个渐进、有意识或需要努力的过程，尤其适用于技能、习惯或长期积累的资产。
“Buy” (购买) 仅指用金钱交换商品或服务，是 “acquire” 的一种具体方式。而 “acquire” 的范围更广，可涵盖继承、学习、赢得、获得等非金钱方式。例如，不能说 “He bought fluency in Spanish”，但可以说 “He acquired fluency in Spanish”。
“Gain” (获得) 通常指获得某种抽象利益，如优势、信任、体重等，语气较中性，常用于正面或中性语境。而 “acquire” 更强调主动性和过程性，尤其适用于长期积累的成果，如知识、技能或资产，语义上更正式、更具体。
